item.description:

  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET ON ONE SIDE. ALL BOTTLES HAD CAPS 1/8 OF A TURN LOOSE. ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP AND FAILED SEAL. SPILL MINOR, ISOLATED TO PACKAGING AND LESS THAN 0.01 OF A GALLON. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024060157
item.description:
Report E-2024060157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-ounces of CitriStrip Paint & Varnish Stripping Gel, was released from one (1) 0.5-gallon plastic jug due to improper dunnage and bracing around the package, causing it to get crushed during transit and leak onto the cardboard container. No surfaces were impacted. The terminal had already placed the contents into a 5-gallon poly drum prior to the call.

item.description:
Report E-2024060149

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-22
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 4-teaspoons of battery acid (hazardous - UN2794) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the pallet. The caller advised the release onto the pallet has dried and there is no waste to contain, and there no damage to the battery. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024060647
item.description:
Report X-2024060647

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024060647: THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IN PROCESS OF BEING LOADED. PACKAGE FELL OFF THE BELT AND STARED LEAKING ON THE FLOOR. RESPONDER STARTED THE PROCESS BY GOING THROUGH DECISION TREE BOOK, THEN CLEANED UP AND FINALLY TOOK PACKAGE TO DMP AND BEGIN THE PROCESS OF A GREEN BAG X-2024060724: THE LEAKING HAZAT PACKAGE WAS IN PROCESS OF BEING LOADED. RESPONDER CALLED FOR AND USED DECISION TREE BOOK. RESPONDER CLEANED UP AND TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR THE PROCESS OF A GREEN BAG

SPILL INITIALLY OCCURED AT WRLT OVERHEAD, PACKAGE WRONGFULLY SENT THROUGH SACR OVERHEAD WHERE DAMAGES EXACERBATED. SPILL 0.2 L. SPILL COLLECTED WITH ABSORBENT MATERIALS. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.description:
Report E-2024060106

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 6-ounces of UN3265 "Ethfac106" released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum impacting dock 65 due to a forklift puncture. The clean-up was performed before the spill was called in. The damaged drum was overpacked into a a 96-gallon poly drum and the spent absorbents were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060103
item.description:
Report E-2024060103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: BAKERSFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-cup of Resin UN1866 released from one (1) 55-gallon steel drum due to being punctured by a forklift. The puncture in the drum has sealed and was no longer leaking. The release happened during transit and was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS went over the SDS with the caller and determined the terminal was capable of clean up with the available PPE on site. The impacted drum was containerized into a 85-gallon drum with the spent absorbents.

item.title: Report X-2024060001
item.description:
Report X-2024060001

  • City: COSTA MESA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. One steel (UN 1A1) drum inside a plastic bag, overpacked in a fiberboard box. Cause of leak is unknown, but it appeared to be leaking from the bottom. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for disposition from the customer.

item.title: Report I-2024060019
item.description:
Report I-2024060019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES -ROSALIND SHELMIRE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Halfway through the flight, passenger 20A, HOLUB/ALEXEIDAVID, told FA Pang that their laptop was emitting an electrical smell. FA conferred with FM and both agreed there was a smell. No flames, heat, or smoke were present. Out of an abundance of caution, the MacBook Pro was placed into the TCB. The TCB was placed in an aft Iav and monitored occasionally per CA instructions occasionally throughout the flight. The TCB remained in the aft Iav until descent, in which it was brought to the forward Iav for easy access upon door opening. Due to no signs of fire, smoke, or heat, pax was escorted to the exit and was able to retrieve the laptop out of the TCB. FAs reminded to fill out IORs and thanked for erring on the side of caution. Name: Alex Eidavid Holub Address: 36 Mayflower Drive Wenham MA 01984 , Phone: 626-676-1736 Email: alexholub@gmail.com

item.title: Report X-2024060112
item.description:
Report X-2024060112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/19/24, we received notification from hub personnel that a foul odor was emitting from ISO tank SUTU 266444. The tank was labeled with the commodity "POLYSULFIDE 9. MARINE POLLUTANT" (UN 3082, HAZMAT), prompting to call out an environmental contractor United Pumping to assess the incident. The responder discovered several loose bolts on the top manway hatch. The product inside the tank appeared to be stable, with no residue or spillover on the top area of the tank. It seems the loose bolts found on the top hatch cover allowed vapor to escape, causing the foul odor. After tightening the bolts, the odor dissipated over some time. The seals on the top hatch remained intact and undamaged.

item.title: Report X-2024060236
item.description:
Report X-2024060236

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-11T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Exterior packaging was wet on one side and on the underside by a thick clear liquid that came from the inside of the package. Inside the 4G box are 4 quantities of 1 gallon plastic bottles containing SEK-Surebond SB-8700 Wet Look Joint Stabilizing Sealer with Anti-fungal. One of the bottles had a streak of liquid leaked on to its body that is coming from under the cap. When the cap was opened, the seal was opened a quarter of the way. The liquid leaked inside the exterior packaging and hardened in an hour. The rest of the bottles were unharmed.

  • City: CERES

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN3149 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew tightened the cap and utilized absorbent pads to remediate the release. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged jug was overpacked into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: The package was found leaking and wet. QA was called and after preparation the area was cleaned/sterilized and the package was taken to the hazmat cage. Upon inspection the package contents were found with loose caps and that was the cause of the spill.
